rules.natural: If event1 is scheduled at the main stage, then event1 is successful.
Provided that sponsorship is secured for event1, event1 is successful.
Either media coverage is positive for event1, or if event1 is not successful, then the audience is not dissatisfied with event1.
Either there is a security breach at event1, or if event1 is organized by organization1, then event1 is scheduled at the main stage.
Whenever security measures are adequate for event1, there is no security breach at event1.
The weather is good for event1, or show1 performs as a headliner at the main stage, or show2 performs as a headliner at the main stage.
In case the weather forecast is bad for event1, the weather is not good for event1.
Should there be negative reviews for event1, the audience is not dissatisfied with event1.
If crisis management is activated for organization1, then if it is not the case that event1 not being successful implies negative reviews for event1, the reputation of organization1 is damaged.
Given that event1 is sponsored by organization1, if event1 is organized by organization1, then event1 is scheduled at the main stage.
Provided that show1 performs as a headliner at the main stage, event1 is successful.
In the event that show2 performs as a headliner at the main stage, event1 is successful.
If a backup system is available at the main stage, then there are no technical issues at the main stage.
Either a backup system is available at the main stage or an alternative venue is available at the secondary stage.
Provided that an alternative venue is available at the secondary stage, there are no technical issues at the main stage.
Should ticket sales be high for event1, event1 is successful.
If neither show1 performs as a headliner at the main stage nor show2 performs as a headliner at the main stage, then there are technical issues at the main stage.
In case neither ticket sales are high for event1 nor sponsorship is secured for event1, there is a financial loss for event1.
If it is not the case that ticket sales are high for event1 or sponsorship is secured for event1, then emergency funding is not needed for event1.
If it is not the case that the absence of high ticket sales or secured sponsorship for event1 implies emergency funding is needed for event1, then event1 is cancelled.
Whenever event1 is not successful, the audience is dissatisfied with event1.

The weather forecast is bad for event1.

It is not the case that there is a financial loss for event1.
It is not the case that media coverage is positive for event1.
It is not the case that event1 is cancelled.
It is not the case that the reputation of organization1 is damaged.

Event1 is successful.

(A1 → G).natural: If event1 is scheduled at the main stage, then event1 is successful.

(A10 → G).natural: Provided that sponsorship is secured for event1, event1 is successful.

(A13 ∨ (¬G → ¬A12)).natural: Either media coverage is positive for event1, or if event1 is not successful, then the audience is not dissatisfied with event1.

(A14 ∨ (A2 → A1)).natural: Either there is a security breach at event1, or if event1 is organized by organization1, then event1 is scheduled at the main stage.

(A15 → ¬A14).natural: Whenever security measures are adequate for event1, there is no security breach at event1.

(A16 ∨ (A4 ∨ A5)).natural: The weather is good for event1, or show1 performs as a headliner at the main stage, or show2 performs as a headliner at the main stage.

(A17 → ¬A16).natural: In case the weather forecast is bad for event1, the weather is not good for event1.

(A2 → A1).natural: Assuming event1 is organized by organization1, event1 is scheduled at the main stage.

(A20 → ¬A12).natural: Should there be negative reviews for event1, the audience is not dissatisfied with event1.

(A22 → (¬(¬G → A20) → A21)).natural: If crisis management is activated for organization1, then if it is not the case that event1 not being successful implies negative reviews for event1, the reputation of organization1 is damaged.

(A3 → (A2 → A1)).natural: Given that event1 is sponsored by organization1, if event1 is organized by organization1, then event1 is scheduled at the main stage.

(A4 → G).natural: Provided that show1 performs as a headliner at the main stage, event1 is successful.

(A4 ∨ A5).natural: Either show1 performs as a headliner at the main stage or show2 performs as a headliner at the main stage.

(A5 → G).natural: In the event that show2 performs as a headliner at the main stage, event1 is successful.

(A7 → ¬A6).natural: If a backup system is available at the main stage, then there are no technical issues at the main stage.

(A7 ∨ A8).natural: Either a backup system is available at the main stage or an alternative venue is available at the secondary stage.

(A8 → ¬A6).natural: Provided that an alternative venue is available at the secondary stage, there are no technical issues at the main stage.

(A9 → G).natural: Should ticket sales be high for event1, event1 is successful.

(A9 ∨ A10).natural: Ticket sales are high for event1 or sponsorship is secured for event1.

(¬(A4 ∨ A5) → A6).natural: If neither show1 performs as a headliner at the main stage nor show2 performs as a headliner at the main stage, then there are technical issues at the main stage.

(¬(A9 ∨ A10) → A11).natural: In case neither ticket sales are high for event1 nor sponsorship is secured for event1, there is a financial loss for event1.

(¬(A9 ∨ A10) → A18).natural: Assuming neither ticket sales are high for event1 nor sponsorship is secured for event1, emergency funding is needed for event1.

(¬(A9 ∨ A10) → ¬A18).natural: If it is not the case that ticket sales are high for event1 or sponsorship is secured for event1, then emergency funding is not needed for event1.

(¬(¬(A9 ∨ A10) → A18) → A19).natural: If it is not the case that the absence of high ticket sales or secured sponsorship for event1 implies emergency funding is needed for event1, then event1 is cancelled.

(¬(¬G → A20) → A21).natural: Should it not be the case that event1 not being successful implies negative reviews for event1, the reputation of organization1 is damaged.

(¬G → A12).natural: Whenever event1 is not successful, the audience is dissatisfied with event1.

(¬G → A20).natural: In the event that event1 is not successful, there are negative reviews for event1.

(¬G → ¬A12).natural: Provided that event1 is not successful, the audience is not dissatisfied with event1.
